intro: Erigeron eatonii f. molestus, commonly known as the wooly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. The subspecies f. molestus is distinguished by its more densely hairy foliage compared to other forms of Erigeron eatonii.
